::Firearm::

Firearm nods, looking around and then at the internal structure 
image. He taps his hand, a panel coming up from his wrist, featuring 
a small built in computer. As the weapon operator of the CF, his 
wrist comp was mainly designed to control the weapons, but it could 
access the other features too. He was sure Hysteria would have a 
better one as the main tech bot, but maybe she didn't.

"From what I saw of the outside, the hull is in very bad condition. 
Lets get the power running first."

He taps a few buttons. With a grinding sound of damaged gears, four 
large panels slid aside on the top of the Cybertronian Fire, and two 
even larger solar batteries were brought up. The lights on the bridge 
became slightly brighter as the solar batteries began to bring in 
energy.

"Allright," he says, walking to a console and looking at the 
damage, "Lets get working on the comps."




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@h...> wrote:
> Hysteria:
> 
> Hysteria sighed deeply before turning to face Firearm:
> 
> "Well, despite how it may look, with enough help and round the 
clock work we 
> could be up and running in about two weeks. But I haven't been able 
to 
> survey all the damage yet."
> 
> Hysteria turned back to face the console, and continued talking to 
Firearm 
> as she pulled up a half completed image of the CF's internal 
structure:
> 
> "There're a lot of internal problems, cut wires, broken links, you 
name it. 
> First, however, I suggest we get the power core up and running 
again. It's 
> barely hanging in there as it is. I'm estimating about 45-55% 
shipwide 
> damage. But that's a very crude estimate, given what I've surveyed 
so far. 
> For all we know the damage may not be as extensive as we think, 
though I 
> seriously doubt that."
